TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PropertyManager extends System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase

Docs.summary: Maintains a between an object's property and a data-bound control property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The PropertyManager inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase>, and it is used to maintain the current property of an object, rather than the property of a current object in a list. For this reason, trying to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.Position%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.Count%2A> property for a PropertyManager has no effect. Similarly, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.AddNew%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.RemoveAt%2A> methods are not supported because there is no underlying list of data to add to or delete from. In addition, a call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.IsBindingSuspended%2A> will always return `false` if the PropertyManager has a data source, regardless of whether <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.SuspendBinding%2A> has been called.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void ResumeBinding() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, resumes data binding.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void SuspendBinding() cil managed

Docs.summary: Suspends the data binding between a data source and a data-bound property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks SuspendBinding and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyManager.ResumeBinding%2A> are two methods that allow the temporary suspension and resumption of data binding. You typically suspend data binding if the user must be allowed to make several edits to data fields before validation occurs. For example, if one field must be changed in accordance with a second, but where validating the first field would cause the second field to be in error. A call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.IsBindingSuspended%2A> will always return `false` if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyManager> has a data source, regardless of whether <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.SuspendBinding%2A> has been called.

Docs.summary: Updates the current between a data binding and a data-bound property.
